name: Porcupine Lamp - Sphere
description:
The Porcupine pendant lamp was inspired by Datura Seed Pods and Native American Indians basketry weaving techniques.

The Porcupine lamp is made up of a steel wire frame tied with Abacá. Strips of Flat Reed Splint are interwoven over the wire shaped frame.

The twist in the weaving allows the lamp to form cones on the external surface. The natural flat reed splint act as a diffuser for the light source producing a natural inner glow.

Size: 40cm Diameter

description:

Size: 30cm Diameter x 35cm H

name: Woven Fruit Bowl
description:
The Woven fruit bowl is a light and elegant vessel. It is inspired by natural materials and aims to bring an aspect of nature into the home. The open weave allows for air to circulate from the bottom as well as the sides to ensure fruit is preserved. 

The design also makes for easy and stable arrangement of a variety of fruits. The design incorporates sustainable design by using natural materials such as Rattan round core and Abaca rope. 

Woven combines craft-based skills of complex weaving with modern design to produce an elegant and understated fruit bowl. It uses traditional weaving skills making each bowl unique.
